lines.text: Incidentally, what's happened to the Count? Where is he?
Where are the snows of yesteryear?
Where the woodbine twineth.
That's where the Count is.
Is this youngster annoying you?
Not at all.
Be a good Scout, sonny, and toddle back to your table.
I wish you'd stop interfering with my affairs.
Oh, I didn't know this was an affair.
Well, whatever it is, I can do without you nicely.
Madam, is this old gentleman annoying you?
Yes. Very decidedly.
So maybe you'd better totter back to your table.
Mademoiselle! Where'd you get this blue eye?
I got the blue one from my mother's side of the family. The black one is a present from a gentleman who's crazy about me.
Ah, c'est l'amour!
Mmm... What can you do about it?
We fix it perfect. If Mademoiselle will sit, please.
Yeah.
First of all, we put on the cold towel. Some astringent maybe. Then some raw beef. Just a small piece.
Put the whole cow on if it'll help any.
How do I look?
Like a street cleaner.
Come, come, come now. You can't win me with flattery.
I've come to take you to the ball.
Oh, you have? Well, I hope you can bear up on it, but I'm going with Stuart Farnum.
I'm sorry, but you're going with me.
I told you I was going with Stu.
Stu? How vulgar. Is that a name or a condition?
That's his name.
Strange. It's also his condition.
He's gonna take me if he has to go on a stretcher.
Scott! Hurry up with the cocktails! I need something to steady my hand.
Now that we're engaged, I hope we'll see each other occasionally.
Whatever is customary, Mr. Miller.
Well, Brinkie's off on one of his short stories again. Probably last an hour. He doesn't even know I left him. Still talking.
That's cruel, Scott.
He doesn't care. The other day while he was spinning his favorite yarn at the club his audience changed three times. He never knew the difference.
You're not planning on coming with me, by any chance?
Certainly not. I have better ways to spend my declining weekends, dear.
Be kind of fun if they didn't show up, wouldn't it? Then we could be alone sort of.
What do you mean *sort of*?
Oh! Be careful, honey. You'll take my cold.
I'll take anything from you, darling. My mother used to say, "You'll never get poor from taking."
What kind of a costume is Stuart wearing?
I don't know. He said something about going as a fudge sundae.
How appealing.
Are you actually smiling?
No. I'm only giving my face a rest.
Have you ever been hit with a slot machine?
[talking through intercom]
Miss Colby's lunching with Mr. Wadsworth.
Ask her if she can dine with me tonight. Tell her my favorite opera's on at the Met.
What opera shall I say?
I don't know. Look it up in the paper.
